question_text:
An application that is hosted on Amazon EC2 instances needs to access an Amazon S3 bucket. Traffic must not traverse the internet.

How should a solutions architect configure access to meet these requirements?

options.A: Create a private hosted zone by using Amazon Route 53.
options.B: Set up a gateway VPC endpoint for Amazon S3 in the VP
options.C: Configure the EC2 instances to use a NAT gateway to access the S3 bucket.
options.D: Establish an AWS Site-to-Site VPN connection between the VPC and the S3 bucket.
